This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"reinitialize(address,uint64)":{"details":"Initializes the contract by setting the pool factory address.","params":{"_poolFactory":"The address of the BaluniV1PoolFactory contract."}},"removeLiquidity(uint256,address)":{"details":"Removes liquidity from a BaluniV1Pool.","params":{"poolAddress":"The address of the BaluniV1Pool.","share":"The amount of liquidity tokens to remove."}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner.
